QUESTIONS.title: What is ballroom dancing?
QUESTIONS.info: "Ballroom" is the term used to refer to a set of 10 rhythms. They belong to the so-called "Standard" rhythms. These include: English Waltz, Viennese Waltz, Tango, Foxtrot, Quickstep. Corresponding to the "Latin" rhythms are: Samba, Cha Cha Cha, Rumba, Paso Doble, Jive.

QUESTIONS.title: Are there ballroom classes for beginners?
QUESTIONS.info: For beginners, intermediates, and advanced levels.

QUESTIONS.title: How should I dress for the classes?
QUESTIONS.info: It is recommended to wear comfortable pants or jogging pants, a t-shirt or comfortable shirt, and flexible shoes or sneakers.

QUESTIONS.title: Do I need to bring a partner to the classes?
QUESTIONS.info: It is not necessary, but for a better experience, we recommend it.

TEXTS.title: Juan Almirón, CEO Founder
TEXTS.info: My passion for dance began when I saw dancer Oleksandr Honcharov. This led me to discover DSC, a dance school that started my journey. At DSC, I met my teachers Mery Lenz and Eugenio Dmytrenko, who deeply influenced my formation.
TEXTS.info2: For years, I competed, standing out and achieving top positions. I have taught classes in various provinces of Argentina. In 2024, I started my BASC project to spread ballroom dancing, share my love for dance, and support new dancers. Join me in this exciting journey!

TEXTS.title: Ballroom Argentina Sport Club
TEXTS.info:
Our mission is to spread the passion for dance throughout Argentina and Latin America.
That's why we offer classes for all levels, whether you dance recreationally or competitively.
Our instructors receive continuous training in ballroom dance, as well as physical preparation and sports psychology. 


Want more information? Feel free to contact us and we will respond as soon as possible!

TEXTS.title: What is Ballroom?
TEXTS.info:
"Ballroom" is the term used to designate a set of 10 rhythms. They belong to the so-called "Standard" rhythms: English Waltz, Viennese Waltz, Tango, Foxtrot, Quickstep. They correspond to the "Latin" rhythms: Samba, Cha Cha Cha, Rumba, Paso Doble, Jive. 



In a competition, you can compete in all 10 rhythms covering Standard and Latin, or in the 5 Standard rhythms, or in the 5 Latin rhythms.

TEXTS.title: Behind every good dancer there is always a great dance teacher.
TEXTS.info: Because they inspire with their passion for dancing. They are a source of motivation, and the bond between a dancer and their coach can be as strong as that between a parent and child...
TEXTS.info2: Because there are coaches who become like parents and parents who become coaches.

TEXTS.title: Why choose BASC?
TEXTS.info:
Our classes are always personalized and tailored to the needs of each student.


Continuous training of our instructors in technique, pedagogy, and sports psychology.
TEXTS.info2:
Friendly and motivating atmosphere.


Participation in national and international events and competitions.

TEXTS.title: They are not just people, they are dance interpreters.
TEXTS.info: And yes, when you step onto the dance floor, you have to force your posture, not look at the floor, exert yourself, try to stand out...
TEXTS.info2: As my coach says when preparing us for tournaments: "You on the dance floor are not people, you are dancers"

TEXTS.title: Showmatch Dancers vs Ballroom Dancers
TEXTS.info: Due to the appearance of ballroom dance on television through shows like 'Showmatch', 'Strictly Come Dancing', or 'Dancing with the Stars', ballroom has gained some popularity. However, it's important to distinguish the differences between original ballroom and the fusion of elements seen in TV shows.
TEXTS.info2:
1) CHOREOGRAPHIES: Choreographies are undoubtedly the main distinctive element between TV contests and original ballroom.


Choreographies for TV shows are primarily aimed at entertainment and spectacle. Ballroom choreographies are guided by the concept of 'elegance', often avoiding tricks and acrobatics.


CONTEXT / ENVIRONMENT: TV contests can stage a whole show around a choreography. They can choose the theme and comfortably have one couple dancing on the floor, without the strict evaluation parameters found in competitive ballroom dancing.


In ballroom tournaments, dancing usually involves several couples at the same time, with no choice in music. While there are predetermined rhythms (Samba, Cha Cha Cha, Rumba, Paso Doble, Jive), dancers cannot choose the song. The music simply plays, and dancers demonstrate their interpretation ability, timing, and dance.


It's much less controlled; couples choreograph accordingly, considering factors like physical connection, choreography, posture and balance, movement quality, musicality, precision, and smooth transitions. However, they don't aim solely for show or attention-seeking; in fact, many times they avoid these factors to maintain the tournament's aesthetics, in other words, to preserve the pure expression of music.

TEXTS.title: Who Wins a Ballroom Tournament?
TEXTS.info:
The fastest?


The most technical?


The most precise?


The most complicated choreography?


The best connection?
TEXTS.info2:
🟡Perhaps a balanced sum of all these factors could be an answer, where they are evenly balanced or excel in one of these qualities. This is good as it marks personal style. We all know how important it is to be unique and original in art.


Bryan Watson says the best dancer is the one who best expresses the music. Technique, tools, and skills are means to that end, but replicating choreography over and over, executing movements mechanically to perfection across all themes and rhythms, won't make you a great dancer. You must adapt your tools to best express the music.


Therefore, choreography with different songs should look different (musically at least). If they all look the same, you're like a 100-meter sprinter who just runs flat out as soon as the bell rings, giving everything physically possible. Perfect, you're a great athlete, but you're not really dancing. And I say you're not really dancing because there's no listening, interpretation, or expression of what the music evokes. Here in dance, we must also consider that it's largely art, and as Bruce said, art is not just embellishment or ornamentation; it's also expression.


Who do you think should win a competition?

TEXTS.title: Three Key Points for Every Beginner Ballroom Practitioner
TEXTS.info: In the initial stages of Ballroom Latin, where a dancer starts with the basics such as figure names, timing for each rhythm, and ballroom fundamentals, it's important to consider the following concepts:
TEXTS.info2:
1. Clear Figures: Clear distinction should be made between a figure, its transition, and the subsequent figure.


2. Precise Timing: Fundamental and critical criterion for evaluating a couple and demonstrating understanding of the musical composition.


3. Correct Posture: Essential for presenting the dancer both individually and as a couple, conveying presence to the audience, clarity in movements, and distinct characterization of each rhythm.

TEXTS.title: Frequently Asked Questions
TEXTS.info:
Do I need previous experience to start taking classes?


No, at BASC we offer classes for all levels, including beginners without prior experience.
TEXTS.info2:
Do I need a partner to take classes?


No, you can enroll without a partner. In our classes, we will assign you a partner to practice with.


What clothing and footwear should I wear for classes?


It's recommended to wear comfortable clothing that allows freedom of movement and suitable footwear for dancing, preferably with leather or similar soles.


How often should I take classes to improve?


The ideal frequency varies based on your goals and availability. However, we recommend at least twice a week for steady progress.

TEXTS.title: The Importance of Connection in Ballroom
TEXTS.info: Connection in ballroom dancing is not just about physical contact, but also about mutual understanding and synchronization between dancers.
TEXTS.info2: Proper connection allows the couple to move as a single unit, interpret music more effectively, and present a harmonious and coherent performance. It is crucial to work on communication and empathy with your dance partner.

TEXTS.title: Physical and Mental Benefits of Ballroom Dancing
TEXTS.info: Ballroom dancing is not only a recreational activity, but also an excellent form of physical and mental exercise.
TEXTS.info2: Practicing ballroom improves cardiovascular health, coordination, balance, and flexibility. It also reduces stress, enhances mood, and promotes socialization. It is a discipline that combines health, art, and entertainment.

TEXTS.title: Events and Competitions
TEXTS.info: At BASC, we actively participate in events and competitions at both national and international levels.
TEXTS.info2: Our students have the opportunity to showcase their progress and skills on various stages, competing with other dancers and gaining valuable experience. Participating in competitions is an excellent way to stay motivated and continuously improve.

TEXTS.title: Testimonials from Our Students
TEXTS.info:

Thanks to BASC, I have discovered a passion for dance that I never imagined. The instructors are amazing and always there to support you." - Ana M.


"BASC is more than a school, it's a family. I have learned a lot and made friends for life." - Carlos R.

TEXTS.title: Our Team
TEXTS.info: At BASC, we have a team of highly qualified instructors who are passionate about dance.
TEXTS.info2: Our teachers have years of experience in teaching and competition. They stay updated with the latest trends and techniques in ballroom dancing, ensuring that you receive the best possible training.

TEXTS.title: Group and Individual Classes
TEXTS.info: We offer both group and individual classes to accommodate your needs and preferences. Group classes are ideal for socializing and learning in a dynamic environment, while individual classes allow for personalized attention and faster progress.

TEXTS.title: Preparation for Competitions
TEXTS.info: At BASC, we prepare our students to compete at the highest level.
TEXTS.info2: We offer specialized training that includes technique, choreography, and physical and mental preparation. Our goal is to ensure that each couple is ready to stand out in any competition.

TEXTS.title: History of Ballroom Dancing
TEXTS.info: Ballroom dancing has a rich history dating back several centuries.
TEXTS.info2: From its origins in the salons of European nobility to its popularization in international competitions, ballroom dancing has constantly evolved, adapting to new trends and styles while always maintaining its essence of elegance and precision.

TEXTS.title: Open Registrations
TEXTS.info: Don't miss the opportunity to join BASC! Registrations are open for all levels.
TEXTS.info2: Visit our website or contact us directly for more information on schedules, fees, and requirements. We are here to help you start your journey in the world of ballroom dancing.

TEXTS.title: Tips to Improve Your Dancing
TEXTS.info: Consistent practice and attention to detail are key to improving in ballroom dancing.
TEXTS.info2: Listen to the music, work on your posture and connection, and don't hesitate to ask for feedback from your instructors. Remember that every mistake is an opportunity to learn and grow.

TEXTS.title: Code of Conduct at BASC
TEXTS.info: To ensure a respectful and safe environment for everyone, we have established some rules of conduct.
TEXTS.info2: All students are expected to arrive on time for classes, respect their peers and instructors, and maintain a positive attitude and openness to learning. Any inappropriate behavior will result in disciplinary action.

TEXTS.title: Contact Us
TEXTS.info: Do you have any questions or need more information?
TEXTS.info2: Feel free to contact us through our social media, email, or phone. We are here to help and answer any questions you may have about our classes and services.

TEXTS.title: The Importance of Attire
TEXTS.info:
In the world of ballroom dancing, attire is not just a superficial detail, but an integral part of the experience. Good attire not only enhances our appearance, but also influences our confidence and comfort as we move across the dance floor. Each outfit contributes to the atmosphere of grace and sophistication that characterizes ballroom dancing. 


So next time you dress up, remember: your attire not only speaks of your style, but also of your commitment to excellence in dance. Dress elegantly and let your passion for dance shine in every move!
